SENT.plain: Pulmonary embolism is the main pulmonary manifestation of primary antiphospholipid syndrome
Other pulmonary manifestations including intra-alveolar haemorrhage are less common
We report a 36-year-old man with a primary antiphospholipid syndrome who presented with an acute respiratory failure due to the association of pulmonary embolism and intra-alveolar haemorrhage
This diagnosis should be systematically considered as it is life threatening and requires a specific therapy
